result.execSummary:
The defendant Takira S Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Takira S Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Takira S Johnson in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Takira S Johnson in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to each other and to any other sentence.   Court will waive any costs that can be waived and ordered any mandatory costs and surcharges that can not be waived to be paid by November 30, 2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court finds that the restitution amount that was requested is accurate but the defendant has no ability to pay.

Attorney Olya Petukhova in court, defendant Takira S Johnson not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was not produced from Winnebago County.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Olya Petukhova in court, defendant Takira S Johnson not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is in custody in the Winnebago County Jail.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Olya Petukhova in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney  Olya Petukhova for Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Takira S Johnson not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was not produced.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Olya Petukhova for Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Takira S Johnson not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a pending revocation hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Olya Petykhova for Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Takira S Johnson not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tezra J.; Rebecca H.; Amanda B.; Christy C. or Tinika A.

Defendant Takira S Johnson in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Takira S Johnson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
